title: Equitable Dominator Coloring of Line Graphs of Some Graphs
authors: Phebe Sarah George and Sudev Naduvath
abstract:
A proper vertex coloring of the graph $G$ such that each vertex dominates at
least one color class and the cardinalities of the color classes differ by at
most $1$ is called an equitable dominator coloring of $G$. The minimum number
of colors used in this coloring is called the equitable dominator chromatic
number (EDCN), represented by $\chi_{ed}(G)$. This article explores the concept
of equitable dominator coloring for the line graph $L(G)$ of some graph
classes.
